Reviews.Title: Works as intended
Reviews.Author: A. D. Krauss
Reviews.Content: First of all, to use this you need a Control Center GE 45129 Choice-Alert Wireless Control Center.A few things to note that were not apparent until I bought this and a Control Center:  - the motion sensor can connect to the Control Center in two ways, either in one of the first three Zones (1, 2, 3) or in the fourth Zone (4) and the Control Center has a different behavior in these two categories.  - In Zone 1, 2, or 3: the motion sensor can only operate in Alarm mode, not in Monitoring mode.  Other sensors apparently can be setup to either Alert, Chime, or just show an indicator light for its assigned Zone based on a switch on the Control Center (the switch has settings of Alert / Chime / Off); this setting is applicable when the Control Center is disarmed (not in AWAY or HOME alarm mode).  But the Motion Sensor DOES NOT work in this way - it ONLY WORKS in AWAY or HOME alarm mode, when assigned to Zone 1, 2 or 3.  - When assigned to Zone 4: the motion sensor triggers an Alert only, which ignores the Alert / Chime / Off switch.  The Alert cannot be silenced, only muted once it starts.Since the alarm is overkill for what we want (monitoring our sleepwalking child), we plan on keeping it in Zone 4, and unplugging the Control Center without batteries in it to shut if off during the day.  The Alert itself should be sufficient to wake us up.

Reviews.Title: slow to set off alarm
Reviews.Author: C. Smith
Reviews.Content: this motion detector works really well at detecting any movement but then doesn't set off the alarm for about 30 seconds, all the while beeping as if to give an intruder directions to the home unit so he can destroy it before the alarm actually sounds. the time between activation of the motion detector and the alarm needs to be shortened.

Reviews.Title: Not Dependable
Reviews.Author: Golf Man
Reviews.Content: The motion sensor was not capable of transmitting a signal to the control center which was located only 60 feet away and only one exterior wall in its path. The wall consisted of vinyl siding 2 windows and a fiberglass door with glass in it. My advice is to buy a more powerful motion sensor which undoubtly will cost more but will be dependable.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality control/ easy fix
Reviews.Author: alarm129
Reviews.Content: When setting up motion detectors, continued to get out of range/ low battery indication on new install. Discovered that poorly manufactured 9v battery connector failed to make tight connection. Hard to believe something this simple could be screwed up, until you note the country of origin. Complete lack of quality control. I'm sure GE was assured this part was made to spec. There is no telling how many of these have been returned, due to such a simple flaw. Wrap the 9v battery and connector once around with electrical tape to secure connection, and it works like a champ.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Motion Detector
Reviews.Author: Brother
Reviews.Content: Great product but be aware that it only works when the control unit is set for "away".  These do not work when you set the control unit for "at home".

Reviews.Title: Very Poorly Designed
Reviews.Author: R. Moss
Reviews.Content: Be aware that this motion sensor suffers from several serious design flaws.  First, it is only active when the control center is set in the Away Mode not the Home Mode.  We have a two-story house.  We wanted to secure the first story while asleep in the second story bedroom.  Setting Home Mode is easy (one beep).  Setting Away Mode results in 45 seconds of loud, annoying beeping.  Not what we want to hear every night before bed.  The first night the system was active the motion sensor set off the alarm for no particular reason.  I turned the system off for the rest of the night.The next day I called GE Tech Support and was told the following:  1) The motion sensor is sensitive to heat/cold coming from registers in the floor (so I guess we should turn our furnace off?) 2) The motion sensor does not have a high/low sensitivity setting (despite the description on Amazon) 3) The remote control unit will still trigger 45 seconds of beeping when setting the Away Mode (so much for my theory of keeping the remote in the bedroom) 4) you cannot use more than one control center (well, there goes my theory of converting from 2 motion sensors to 15 door/window sensors plus garage plus flood sensors which would require 2 control centers).So, I am uninstalling the system, returning it to Amazon, and doing a much better job of research for my next security system.By the way my old system worked fine for 18 years until the system died from old age and the company that made it went out of business.  I'm so glad everything is made in China these days.

Reviews.Title: You have to be kidding!
Reviews.Author: Anne Brenner
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product, the base unit, a remote, and a supplementary alarm. This product did not work at all. To start out, the base unit would not let me program a new code. I programed zones 1 and 2 for the motion detectors and tried the alert and chime settings. They went off whether or not the unit was armed. After about an hour, neither the chime nor alert worked and could not be reprogramed. The supplementary alarm worked because the remote panic button set it off but the motion detector would not set it off.

Reviews.Title: Motion sensors don't work for instant alarm.
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I bought this with the intention of placing the motion sensors throughout my house and having the receiver unit in the bedroom so that I could be alerted if someone came in the house at night.  The system is described as having a "Home" mode with an instant alarm and an "Away" mode with a delayed alarm.  What they don't tell you (until you open the product and read the owner's manual) is that the motion sensors don't work in the "Home" mode.

Reviews.Title: GE Home Security System Riddled with Defects
Reviews.Author: tmfnyc
Reviews.Content: The red flashing test light does not work and the device does not work properly.  The whole line of GE home protection units have one defect of another.  Very cheaply made.

Reviews.Title: Wish It Worked Like GE Says It Does
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these motion sensors.  After initiating communications between the sensors and the base unit I found two disturbing things.  First, they do NOT communicate up to 150 feet - I was lucky (after moving the base unit around a dozen times) to get about 35 feet with fresh batteries with nothing more than two drywall walls between them.  Not very useful and this forces you to put the base unit in potentially awkward places.  Second, as far as being weather-resistant?  I found that they stopped working when their temperatures dropped below 35 degrees.  So, unless you live in Florida, my observations indicate that these are not useful anywhere but in a nice, dry, warm environment.  I did find the construction of the sensors to be adequate.  But I must take issue with the base unit... it's cheaply built and does not function exactly like the manual states.  Further, YOU CANNOT USE THESE motion sensors in ANY mode except for "Armed When You Leave The House Mode"... so I have to question, what's the point then!  Final opinion:  not a well thought out product, cheap, doesn't work well, and well, you get what you pay for and I'm upset I wasted my time and money on these.  They're pretty much JUNK.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: QBee "BeBe C"
Reviews.Content: FAST AND EASY DELIVERY. Exactly as described. U don't need anything except batteries. Perfect for home. Alarm is loud and it detects.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: IMC "IMC"
Reviews.Content: It is easy to install and it works very well for my needs. So far, it worked well when I tested it.

Reviews.Title: Never worked right
Reviews.Author: Roberta A. Saucier "Robysbest"
Reviews.Content: Hasn't worked correctly since we bought it.  Very costly and difficult to change batteries which it seems to need too often.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I have two of these senors -one in the front of the house and one in the back. Very sensitive and the range is as advertised. No problem at all with sync'ing it to the control center.

Reviews.Title: It will work
Reviews.Author: Robert L Coker
Reviews.Content: For the money it did what I needed it to do.  i wish it were a little louder.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: not the best
Reviews.Author: J. B.
Reviews.Content: these are ok,but the signal does not reach as far as they claim and these do not like cold air.

Reviews.Title: Highly accurate
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Once positioned where you want it, it will detect motion for about 180 degrees from mounting. Detects large object movement but not small pets.

Reviews.Title: works fine
Reviews.Author: Anthony Fanning
Reviews.Content: it works. and was easy to install.  with existing system . it works .... it works and it works good.

Reviews.Title: Very Sensitive
Reviews.Author: PatPend
Reviews.Content: I have always been impressed with GE alarm systems and this is no exception. This unit is installed outside and works great. If I have a complaint, it would be to ask for a sensitivity control so I could lower the sensitivity, as it is now, it will pick up even birds (e.g., it is not Pet Immune). That being said, I use it to hear when guests are coming before they knock, and at night for any nefarious activities in the driveway (no birds at night) - works great; Very Sensitive.

Reviews.Title: Alert Motion Sensor
Reviews.Author: Hasty P
Reviews.Content: The GE 45132 Choice-Alert Motion Sensor works well with the GE 45142 Control Center. This system is very mobile, so you can take it from one place to another and set it up quickly. I recommend purchasing a switch to splice into the power cord of the Control Center so you can turn the center on and off without having to unplug it from the outlet. Also, black electrical tape works well at covering the bright LED lights on the Control Center for those who do not need night lights. Remember to test the system every once in a while to make sure it is working.

Reviews.Title: motion
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This security system works well. Sometimes difficult to get programmed, but once programmed it works great and gives some relief of security and a good night's sleep. The motion detection works great and the other accessories go great with the unit. All accessories I added only made the system better.You can't get by these things... but the best part is, couple this with door and window sensors... and you will sleep fine. in the summer with the windows open and the motion sensors turned on. No one will get by or through the window without you knowing it!

Reviews.Title: Working Distant
Reviews.Author: Electrical Engineer
Reviews.Content: The device working distant is less than what it's advertised to .A repeater unit is needed when installed in large area, but such device is not available for sale by the manufacture .

Reviews.Title: Very good option for porch.
Reviews.Author: Coffee Lover
Reviews.Content: Face It!  An alarm sounding anywhere does not bring the police running.  An alarm sounding is not a priority call.  We wanted an alarm to make sure we were awake in the event of an intruder breaking in.  This whole system fits the bill.  It is super easy to install, not super expensive, and lets us know that some is trying to or has just entered our home especially while we are sleeping.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised for a good price
Reviews.Author: D. Ludwig "ludes1"
Reviews.Content: Needed an unmonitored alarm for lake cabin.  This works as advertised with the control panel.  Highly recommend.  Amazon has best price I could find on these by large margin

Reviews.Title: short distance to base station
Reviews.Author: Michael Stepenaskie
Reviews.Content: This does not broadcast to my base station 1 room away.  Its usless except in the same roomy, try a combined motion dector and alarm combined.

Reviews.Title: Seeing eye
Reviews.Author: HSP
Reviews.Content: This unit works fairly well, it has a limited viewing angle and distance.  Meaning, it would not detect until I was within 10 toe 12 feet of the unit as compared to the specified 40 feet.  We installed it in a hall-way, this may have been a factor.

Reviews.Title: A Perfect Sensor to Cover Windows and Doors.
Reviews.Author: A. Tabatabaie
Reviews.Content: This motion sensor, added to the GE Choice Alert command center and a door sensor, gives you the capability to cover the front entrance and the rear door and windows of the average home. The setup to add this device to your existing GE Choice Alert alarm sytem, is very easy. I definitely recommend this motion sensor.

Reviews.Title: I don't get all the negative reviews
Reviews.Author: Ryan Leafgreen
Reviews.Content: I've read several reviews on these things being flaky or having issues. I have purchased 5 of these so far and have had zero problems. One thing is true though, they do not have much range. If you have a two story home, don't bother with this system. It's designed for very small areas, and the range to the base station even with extenders (I have two) sucks. It can be the difference of 5 ft sometimes and only one room away from the control center if they work or not. Once you have them set, and working every time they stay working. For a cheap alarm system I have been very happy with the motion detectors. They trip every time and work in both day and night.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: German
Reviews.Content: Easy to install, good construction quality.I install 5 of this sensors in my house. I also get the panic button and the key control access

Reviews.Title: Motion Alarm
Reviews.Author: 45th_Johnny
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Does just it is suppose to do.  Just mount it and turn it on.  Just what you need to cover areas not covered by your monitored system.

Reviews.Title: Motion Sensor
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Make sure you have enough time to set this up. Do it during the day because it's a very loud set-up. Also you must purchase the "Control Center" to arm this detector. There was no mention of that when I made my purchase.

Reviews.Title: read closer about product
Reviews.Author: Bugsy
Reviews.Content: This was my very first purchase. Service was great. I did not see that I also need another product for this to work. I know it is what I need now. I have learned now to look at the information closely.

Reviews.Title: Undependable motion sensors GE 45132
Reviews.Author: DSG
Reviews.Content: Un-dependable. I bought 4 units GE 45132 for use in India; not one works. The learn button triggers the built in LED but not movements. Completely unexpected from a GE product.

Reviews.Title: Useless unless you wish to set AWAY alarm on
Reviews.Author: Jimsworld
Reviews.Content: GE45132 ONLY WORKS for crazy loud alarm mode when you are away. Will not work otherwise.Great if at night you put the system into wake-you-the-hell-up-by-friggin-loud-alarm mode.Otherwise, this is best used as a fake motion detector, to deter dumb criminals roaming around your back patio at night.Light does flicker nicely, and if you fake wire it to a fake security cam you might deter some idiot trying to steal your stuff.

Reviews.Title: too sensitive
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I bought a "system" with 4 motion sensors and a control panel.  All works acceptably,but we are using it for the perimeter around the house, and it is set off by cats and foxes.
